news_header: Funding allocations for urban development in Finland's Turku region.
news_text: Helsinki received the second highest funding, while Lahti was third, with Raisio having the largest funding pot in the Turku region. The state has allocated a total of EUR 331 million for MAL projects in the area, with an overall funding of EUR 572 million planned for 2024-2027 to support sustainable growth in major urban areas. The MAL agreements outline state financing for transport projects until 2035, including approximately EUR 150 million for the Raisio Central Tunnel. The City of Raisio will vote on the approval of the MAL agreement.
